TypeSignature.Value: .class public interface auto ansi abstract ICredentialProvider

Docs.summary:
CredentialProvider interface. This interface allows Bots to provide their own implementation of what is, and what is not, a valid appId and password. This is useful in the case of multi-tenant bots, where the bot may need to call out to a service to determine if a particular appid/password pair is valid.
For Single Tenant bots (the vast majority) the simple static providers are sufficient.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<string> GetAppPasswordAsync(string appId) cil managed
Public Function GetAppPasswordAsync (appId As String) As Task(Of String)

Docs.param: The ID of the app to get the password for.
Docs.summary: Gets the app password for a given bot app ID.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful and the app ID is valid, the result contains the password; otherwise, null.
This method is async to enable custom implementations that may need to call out to serviced to validate the appId / password pair.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> IsAuthenticationDisabledAsync() cil managed
Public Function IsAuthenticationDisabledAsync () As Task(Of Boolean)

Docs.summary: Checks whether bot authentication is disabled.
Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful and bot authentication is disabled, the result is true; otherwise, false.
This method is async to enable custom implementations that may need to call out to serviced to validate the appId / password pair.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Threading.Tasks.Task`1<bool> IsValidAppIdAsync(string appId) cil managed
Public Function IsValidAppIdAsync (appId As String) As Task(Of Boolean)

Docs.returns: A task that represents the work queued to execute.
Docs.remarks:
If the task is successful, the result is true if is valid for the controller; otherwise, false.
This method is async to enable custom implementations that may need to call out to serviced to validate the appId / password pair.
